start.text: By a magical force, you instantly arrive at the wizard's tower

start.speaker: guido
start.text: Wow my head feels a little weird... Where am I?

start.speaker: professor
start.text: Welcome to the Wizard's tower! Sinterklaas told me that you might drop by.

start.speaker: professor
start.text: I heard that you might be looking for a Dramen staff. Luckily for you, I am in possession of such an item.

start.speaker: guido
start.text: Great! Could you hand it over?

start.speaker: professor
start.text: Of course! If you would simply be so kind to give me a glass of beer!

start.speaker: wizard
start.text: Professor will you stop memeing already?

start.speaker: wizard
start.text: No my dear boy, Sinterklaas asked us to test your knowledge. If you manage to pass the test, we will hand over the staff!

start.speaker: professor
start.text: So, are you ready to take on the knowledge test?

choices.text: Yes of course! This will be a piece of cake.
No fuck you guys! That's lame!

decline.speaker: professor
decline.text: Well then, no present for you! Come back when you change your mind!

question1.speaker: wizard
question1.text: Very well! Here is my first question:

question1.speaker: wizard
question1.text: Who is the God of law?

question2.speaker: black-wizard
question2.text: Good answer! Now it is my turn to ask a question.

question2.speaker: black-wizard
question2.text: What is the name of the highest level monster you face in the final fight of Recipe for Disaster?

question3.speaker: wizard
question3.text: Good job! I knew you would answer that one correctly.

question3.speaker: wizard
question3.text: Here is my next and the third question.

question3.speaker: wizard
question3.text: How much experience in total will you get if you mine enough ore for two rune bars?

question4.speaker: professor
question4.text: Impressive work, stranger. I wonder whether you will be able to answer this.

question4.speaker: professor
question4.text: Which of these cannot be made into a potion with Avantoe?

question5.speaker: black-wizard
question5.text: I am most impressed stranger! Now I will ask a question about the best skill there is.

question5.speaker: black-wizard
question5.text: If I crafted one pure essence of every rune I can at level 64 runecrafting, how many runes will I have?

phase2.speaker: professor
phase2.text: You seem to know your way around the world of RuneScape stranger. I did not expect as much.

phase2.speaker: professor
phase2.text: However, let's test if you ever go outside. What do you know about the real world?

question6.speaker: professor
question6.text: A merchant can place 8 large boxes or 10 smalle boxes into a carton for shipping. In one shipment, he sent a total of 96 boxes. If there are more large boxes than small boxes, how many cartons did he ship?

question7.speaker: black-wizard
question7.text: Good job! You seem to be very good at math! How about your political background?

question7.speaker: black-wizard
question7.text: How many presidents have ruled over the United States of America?

question8.speaker: wizard
question8.text: Not bad at all, how about the next one?

question8.speaker: wizard
question8.text: What is the most common type of star found in the Milky Way?

question9.speaker: professor
question9.text: So you even seem to know your way around the universe.

question9.speaker: professor
question9.text: But how about some smaller stuff?

question9.speaker: professor
question9.text: How many neurons can be found in the human brain?

question10.speaker: leprechaun
question10.text: It seems these guys have been asking the wrong questions all along.

question10.speaker: leprechaun
question10.text: I will put you to the real test!

question10.speaker: leprechaun
question10.text: What do the M's stand for in the M&Ms candy?

q10a.speaker: leprechaun
q10a.text: I'm amazed! You even managed to correctly answer the question that really matters.

complete.speaker: professor
complete.text: My apologies stranger, it seems that I have underestimated you.

complete.speaker: professor
complete.text: Very good job. Please accept this as a reward for your intelligence.

reward.text: The wizard hands over the Dramen staff, and quickly flashes something that could be called a smile.

retry.speaker: professor
retry.text: HA! I knew you were not smart enough. It seems that Sinterklaas overestimated you.

retry.speaker: professor
retry.text: Come back here when you have regained your intelect.

back.speaker: professor
back.text: Aaah it seems you're back to fail once more.

back.speaker: professor
back.text: Let's see if you manage to fail a little bit less this time.
